column4: Can someone help me with a samba issue? After intalling a new HD and sharing a folder on that drive. All my old shares are no longer visable on windows.  I've even removed the share on the new HD but the windows pcs still can't see my old shares.
install swat and reset them up
I'd prefer to try to fix what I already had before intsalling something new. Any suggestions before trying that?
swat will work on your current configuration
apt-get install swat, then enable it via /etc/inetd.conf (should have it set) then point your web browser to http://localhost:901 and login as admin
since it only takes a min to install I'll try installing swat, can you help after I do?
don't forget to install samba-doc if you haven't already - once you use it you will see how nice it is
i'll be around for a little while, gotta sleep soon
dpkg -l | grep ^ii | grep samba-doc
looks like I have it all installed now. What next
sudo netstat -nap | grep 901
should see something like this: tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:901             0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN     5096/xinetd
good. open firefox or whatever and throw it at http://localhost:901
and just hand it root's credentials
that doesn't load up. I'm connected to ewbmin just fine though.
is this a personal or production system?
personal
egads, webmin is just... evil! okay, i'll hold back anymore opinions on that... is samba running on the same computer you're on or another host?
oh ok, then point your web browser at that system then, giving it 901 as the port number
I did, unable to connect. I tried connecting using vnc and and I couldn't load http://localhost:901
ok. when you installed swat, did it installed anything else, like openbsd-inetd?
btw, what version of ubuntu do you have on there?
no it doesn't look like it installed anything else
was that supposed to be netstat -nap | grep 901  ?
yes.
when I typed the netstat command, the results were several lines of
ignore those, there should be one that says LISTEN on it
none of them say listen  just lots of stream connected (7 lines)
ok then it didn't start right - do you get any results with this command: dpkg -l | grep ^ii | grep inetd    ?
-bash: pkg: command not found
dpkg  :)
I copies and pasted your line exactly
ii update-inetd 4.27-0.2 inetd.conf updater
ok, give this a shot then: apt-get install xinetd
okay done.
now check it again:   netstat -nap | grep 901 | grep LISTEN
I ran netstat -nap | grep 901 | grep LISTEN and didn't get an error or anything but I still can't load the web page
ok, check to see if this file exists: /etc/xinetd.d/swat
-bash: /etc/xinet.d/swat: No such file or directory
try this then:  dpkg-reconfigure swat
okay done
see if it's there now
still doesn't exist
rob@Ubuntu:~# dpkg-reconfigure swat
don't worry about pasting anything :)
what number does this command provide?  ls /etc/xinetd.d/ | wc -l
what about http://pastebin.ca ?
http://pastebin.ca/965793
sec
put that in your /etc/xinetd.d/swat  http://pastebin.ca/965796
uh. I dont have a folder inetd.d
i thought maybe I was doing someting wrong in ssh so I loggedin with vnc and I can't find it
it's xinetd.d lol
okay, I created the file swat and pasted your text
ok, now: /etc/init.d/xinetd restart
stopping, starting
okay I can access the webpage now, whats the un/pass same as my regular?
whatever you set root to :)
okay logged in
if you login as regular user you won't be able to do everything
I'm as root
oh ok cool. click on stuff. read things. dive in. enjoy.
:( that doesn't exactly help
the only way to learn it is to, quite honestly, USE it
you've got icons across the top. click on them, experiment, poke around - just don't click on 'commit' yet
i was fine before installing swat. it's just that ever since I installed the new hd and shared a folder my other shares weren't accessable from windows. howe am I supposed to figure out  why
check out your shares button
the existing shares are still there
you should have a drop-down list of all of your shares.
then see if they're browsable or available
browsable is no. if I change that to yes, I supopse that will fix... if I set default that makes it for all shares?
make it 'yes', it will only affect that share.
and if it doesn't work right away, 'restart all' on the status button will fix that :)
neat, one of my shares got deleted when I changed to to browsable and commited changes
are you sure about that? click on another button then go back to it and try to select it again
no, I was mistaken, it keeps changeing to print$. CAn I delete print$ I dont have any printers
print$ is a default printer thing for samba, it's harmless. best off to leave it alone.
when it says available that does that mean. I set browsable adn available to yes on both. I stil can't connect with windows
brb rebooting windows
wb
hi
rebooted winows. still can't connect to \\myubuntu previously I could atleast do that and see the printers folder now it doesn't even
windows can't find it, check spelling etc.
did you set your windows box to the same workgroup as the samba server?
yes, it always has been. Aside from installing the new hd on ubuntu, and creating the share onthat hd I made absolutely no changes to anything else
that's why I'm so frustrated that it just stopped working and wont see my other shares
ok, just checking. what sort of security do you have set for samba? is it share or user?
some how smb was turned off. started it up again, seems fine.... crossing fingers by readding the share on the new hd
ok

okay looks good thanks. just want to say that swat gui is a little unuser friendly when choosing shares. I have to rechoose the share many times because it keeps loading the printer one even though i picked something else and clicked choose
i appreciate it. time for bed
yeah, it's fairly hard-edged a bit, but it's really the most user-friendly gui for setting up samba correctly
cheers, nite
